scheme_data.shortDescription: {"id": "7gLVIY0BsSMYTfziE-Ex", "fields": {"beneficiaryState": ["Kerala"], "schemeShortTitle": "AK", "level": "State", "nodalMinistryName": null, "schemeCategory": ["Health & Wellness"], "schemeName": "Aswasakiranam", "schemeCloseDate": null, "slug": "ak", "briefDescription": "Aswasakiranam Scheme envisages assisting the caregivers of physically and mentally disabled bedridden patients, who are their family members or relatives. All those who have been providing caregiving service to patients since 02/08/10 will be paid monthly assistance with retrospective effect.", "age": {"ews": {"gte": 1, "lte": 100}, "sc": {"gte": 1, "lte": 100}, "general": {"gte": 1, "lte": 100}, "obc": {"gte": 1, "lte": 100}, "st": {"gte": 1, "lte": 100}, "female": {"gte": 1, "lte": 100}, "widowed": {"gte": 1, "lte": 100}}, "tags": ["Mentally Disabled", "Financial Assistance", "Physically Disabled", "Money Assistance"]}, "highlight": {}}
scheme_data.description:
The name of this welfare scheme is Aswasakiranam. It is also known as AK. Detailed 
Kerala is a state well known for its efficient and effective health care system. Despite these advancements, much headway could not be made in-home care. Most of the lowest income group always opt for homely treatment as they cannot afford the charges levied by the well-known hospitals. They are bedridden causing a heavy social burden on their family members who are forced to stay back at home to look after these bedridden patients. While the upper-income group can possibly afford to engage paid caregivers or home nurses for looking after such bedridden family members, the lower-income group usually take it upon themselves to care for their bedridden brethren. These family members in fact function as informal caregivers, without due recognition or economic gain.
<br>

Coverage Of Diseases 
●	All bed-ridden patients who need a full-time caregiver.
●	Mentally challenged (Autism, Cerebral Palsy, Mental retardation, Mental illness).
●	100 % blind, bed-ridden cancer patients, old-aged bed-ridden.
●	Brittle bone disease. The scheme targets beneficiaries such as Individual. It is specifically implemented in Kerala. The implementing agency is Kerala Social Security Mission. Additionally, the nodal department is Social Justice Department.

It falls under the categories: Health & Wellness.

Eligibility criteria include: Eligibility 

One who is totally bedridden and at home with a debilitating disability (physical, functional or mental).
One can not take care of himself/herself for any daytoday activity without the support of another person.
One who belongs to a family, Below Poverty Line as per the BPL list and as per the ration card. For more information, please refer to: Details: https://socialsecuritymission.gov.in/scheme_info.php?id=NQ== Application Form: https://socialsecuritymission.gov.in/appln_info.php Tags associated with the scheme include: Financial Assistance, Mentally Disabled, Money Assistance, Physically Disabled.

scheme_data.combined_text:
The name of this welfare scheme is Aswasakiranam. It is also known as AK. Detailed 
Kerala is a state well known for its efficient and effective health care system. Despite these advancements, much headway could not be made in-home care. Most of the lowest income group always opt for homely treatment as they cannot afford the charges levied by the well-known hospitals. They are bedridden causing a heavy social burden on their family members who are forced to stay back at home to look after these bedridden patients. While the upper-income group can possibly afford to engage paid caregivers or home nurses for looking after such bedridden family members, the lower-income group usually take it upon themselves to care for their bedridden brethren. These family members in fact function as informal caregivers, without due recognition or economic gain.
<br>

Coverage Of Diseases 
●	All bed-ridden patients who need a full-time caregiver.
●	Mentally challenged (Autism, Cerebral Palsy, Mental retardation, Mental illness).
●	100 % blind, bed-ridden cancer patients, old-aged bed-ridden.
●	Brittle bone disease. The scheme targets beneficiaries such as Individual. It is specifically implemented in Kerala. The implementing agency is Kerala Social Security Mission. Additionally, the nodal department is Social Justice Department.

It falls under the categories: Health & Wellness.

Eligibility criteria include: Eligibility 

One who is totally bedridden and at home with a debilitating disability (physical, functional or mental).
One can not take care of himself/herself for any daytoday activity without the support of another person.
One who belongs to a family, Below Poverty Line as per the BPL list and as per the ration card. For more information, please refer to: Details: https://socialsecuritymission.gov.in/scheme_info.php?id=NQ== Application Form: https://socialsecuritymission.gov.in/appln_info.php Tags associated with the scheme include: Financial Assistance, Mentally Disabled, Money Assistance, Physically Disabled.

sentences.sent: The name of this welfare scheme is Aswasakiranam.
It is also known as AK.
Detailed Kerala is a state well known for its efficient and effective health care system.
Despite these advancements, much headway could not be made in-home care.
Most of the lowest income group always opt for homely treatment as they cannot afford the charges levied by the well-known hospitals.
They are bedridden causing a heavy social burden on their family members who are forced to stay back at home to look after these bedridden patients.

While the upper-income group can possibly afford to engage paid caregivers or home nurses for looking after such bedridden family members, the lower-income group usually take it upon themselves to care for their bedridden brethren.
These family members in fact function as informal caregivers, without due recognition or economic gain.
<br> Coverage Of Diseases ● All bed-ridden patients who need a full-time caregiver.
● Mentally challenged (Autism, Cerebral Palsy, Mental retardation, Mental illness).
● 100 % blind, bed-ridden cancer patients, old-aged bed-ridden.
● Brittle bone disease.
The scheme targets beneficiaries such as Individual.
It is specifically implemented in Kerala.
The implementing agency is Kerala Social Security Mission.
Additionally, the nodal department is Social Justice Department.
It falls under the categories: Health & Wellness.
Eligibility criteria include: Eligibility One who is totally bedridden and at home with a debilitating disability (physical, functional or mental).
One can not take care of himself/herself for any daytoday activity without the support of another person.
One who belongs to a family, Below Poverty Line as per the BPL list and as per the ration card.
For more information, please refer to: Details: https://socialsecuritymission.

in/scheme_info.
php?

All those who have been providing caregiving service to patients since 02/08/10 will be paid monthly assistance with retrospective effect.

", "detailedDescription": [{"type": "align_justify", "children": [{"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": "Detailed ", "bold": true}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": "Kerala is a state well known for its efficient and effective health care system.
Despite these advancements, much headway could not be made in-home care.
Most of the lowest income group always opt for homely treatment as they cannot afford the charges levied by the well-known hospitals.
They are bedridden causing a heavy social burden on their family members who are forced to stay back at home to look after these bedridden patients.

While the upper-income group can possibly afford to engage paid caregivers or home nurses for looking after such bedridden family members, the lower-income group usually take it upon themselves to care for their bedridden brethren.
These family members in fact function as informal caregivers, without due recognition or economic gain.

"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": "\u25cf\tBrittle bone disease.

"}]}, {"type": "list_item", "children": [{"text": "All those citizens who have been providing caregiving services to the patients since 2nd August 2010 will be provided monthly assistance.
"}]}, {"type": "list_item", "children": [{"text": "This financial assistance will be apart from the pension given to the patients.

"}]}, {"type": "list_item", "children": [{"text": "Now the caregivers will not be required to depend on anyone for financial support because the government is going to provide them with monthly assistance which will help them in fulfilling their day-to-day needs.

They are bedridden causing a heavy social burden on their family members who are forced to stay back at home to look after these bedridden patients.

ctus.text: The name of this welfare scheme is Aswasakiranam. It is also known as AK. Detailed Kerala is a state well known for its efficient and effective health care system. It falls under the categories: Health & Wellness. Eligibility criteria include: Eligibility One who is totally bedridden and at home with a debilitating disability (physical, functional or mental). One can not take care of himself/herself for any daytoday activity without the support of another person.

", "detailedDescription": [{"type": "align_justify", "children": [{"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": "Detailed ", "bold": true}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "children": [{"text": "Kerala is a state well known for its efficient and effective health care system.

Despite these advancements, much headway could not be made in-home care. Most of the lowest income group always opt for homely treatment as they cannot afford the charges levied by the well-known hospitals. They are bedridden causing a heavy social burden on their family members who are forced to stay back at home to look after these bedridden patients. They are bedridden causing a heavy social burden on their family members who are forced to stay back at home to look after these bedridden patients. While the upper-income group can possibly afford to engage paid caregivers or home nurses for looking after such bedridden family members, the lower-income group usually take it upon themselves to care for their bedridden brethren. These family members in fact function as informal caregivers, without due recognition or economic gain.

<br>

**Coverage Of Diseases** 
●	All bed-ridden patients who need a full-time caregiver. 
●	Mentally challenged (Autism, Cerebral Palsy, Mental retardation, Mental illness). 
●	100 % blind, bed-ridden cancer patients, old-aged bed-ridden. One can not take care of himself/herself for any day-to-day activity without the support of another person. 
1. One who belongs to a family, Below Poverty Line as per the BPL list and as per the ration card.

prompts.ctu_text:
<br>

**Coverage Of Diseases** 
●	All bed-ridden patients who need a full-time caregiver. 
●	Mentally challenged (Autism, Cerebral Palsy, Mental retardation, Mental illness). 
●	100 % blind, bed-ridden cancer patients, old-aged bed-ridden. One can not take care of himself/herself for any day-to-day activity without the support of another person. 
1. One who belongs to a family, Below Poverty Line as per the BPL list and as per the ration card.

It falls under the categories: Health & Wellness. Eligibility criteria include: Eligibility One who is totally bedridden and at home with a debilitating disability (physical, functional or mental).
